current-chamber.#text: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

official-title.#text:
To direct the Administrator of the Environmental Protection Agency to carry out a pilot program to
			 work with municipalities that are seeking to develop and implement
			 integrated plans to meet wastewater and stormwater obligations under the
			 Federal Water Pollution Control Act, and for other purposes.

committee-name.#text: Committee on Environment and Public Works

cosponsor.#tail: ) introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Clean Water Compliance and Affordability Act
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Clean Water Compliance and Affordability Act

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

header.#text: Integrated municipal stormwater and wastewater approach framework

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: (referred to in this section as the
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
Administrator of
			 the Environmental Protection Agency

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall work cooperatively with and
			 facilitate the efforts of eligible municipalities to develop and implement
			 integrated plans to meet wastewater and stormwater obligations of the
			 eligible municipalities under the

text.#text: In the first 5 fiscal years beginning after the date of enactment of this Act, the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: in a more cost-effective and flexible manner.

quote.#tail:
), in coordination with appropriate State, local, and regional authorities, shall carry out a pilot
			 program under which the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall carry out the pilot program in a manner that is consistent with the
			 Integrated Municipal Stormwater and Wastewater Approach Framework issued
			 by the

text.#text: The

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
, in consultation with States that have approved National Pollutant Discharge
			 Elimination System programs, shall select not less than 15 eligible
			 municipalities to participate in the pilot program.

text.#text: The

An eligible municipality is a county, city, town, township, or subdivision of a State or local
			 government that—
qualifies as a National Pollutant Discharge Elimination System permit holder or designee; or

is a party to an administrative order, administrative consent agreement, or judicial consent decree
			 to comply with the requirements of the

eligible municipalities that are operating under an administrative order, administrative consent
			 agreement, or judicial consent decree to comply with the requirements of
			 the

eligible municipalities that are affected by affordability constraints in planning and
			 implementing control measures to address wet weather discharges from
			 wastewater and stormwater facilities of the eligible municipalities; and

eligible municipalities with a history of knowledgeable, detailed, and comprehensive efforts to
			 develop integrated and adaptive clean water management practices.
In selecting the eligible municipalities to participate in the pilot program, the
the use of new innovative technical or institutional approaches; and

the ability to adapt the integrated plan in response to new regulatory requirements and reductions
			 in financial capability.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
may
			 give priority to an eligible municipality that is seeking to develop and
			 implement an integrated plan that includes adaptive approaches to account
			 for changed or future uncertain circumstances, including, at a minimum—

text.#text: In selecting eligible municipalities to participate in the pilot program, the

In approving the integrated plan of an eligible municipality under the pilot program established
			 under subsection (a), the

account for the financial capability of the eligible municipality to adequately address the
			 requirements of the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: that apply to the eligible municipality;

text.#text: prioritize the obligations of the eligible municipality under the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
according to the most cost-effective and
			 environmentally beneficial outcomes;

text.#text:
account for the maintenance, operational, and regulatory obligations of the eligible municipality;
			 and

enable the eligible municipality to implement innovative and flexible approaches to meet the
			 obligations of the eligible municipality under the

may, in full
			 coordination and mutual agreement with an eligible municipality selected
			 to participate in the pilot program—

text.#text: In carrying out the pilot program established under subsection (a), the
extend the allowable national pollutant discharge elimination system permit term under

section 402
			 of the Federal Water Pollution Control Act

text.#text:
modify the implementation terms of a consent decree entered into by the eligible municipality with
			 the
provide additional regulatory flexibility under the

shall submit to Congress a report on the results

Not later than 1 year after the date of enactment of this Act, and each year thereafter for 5

eligible municipalities participating in the pilot program; and
